heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 21 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.3°C) and outside temperature (down 1.7°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.3 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.0°C), feels like temperature (up 2.4°C), and rainfall (down 0.1 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 232.1m higher than yesterday, 8.1m lower than the past week, 290.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 697m and a peak of 1474m, averaging 1187.4m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and near calm conditions. Rain showers likely, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and a mix of sun and clouds. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
